buy.description: Either the ID received from a Price Proposal (proposal) call, or '1' if contract buy parameters are passed in the parameters field.

parameters.description: [Optional] Used to pass the parameters for contract buy.

app_markup_percentage.description: [Optional] Markup added to contract prices (as a percentage of contract payout)

barrier.description: [Optional] Barrier for the contract (or last digit prediction for digit contracts). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Synthetic Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers.

barrier2.description: [Optional] Low barrier for the contract (for contracts with two barriers). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Synthetic Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers.

basis.description: [Optional] Indicates whether amount is 'payout' or 'stake' for binary options.

currency.description: This can only be the account-holder's currency

date_expiry.description: [Optional] Epoch value of the expiry time of the contract. You must either specify date_expiry or duration.

date_start.description: [Optional] For forward-starting contracts, epoch value of the starting time of the contract.

duration_unit.description: [Optional] Duration unit is s(seconds), m(minutes), h(hours), d(days), t(ticks)

limit_order.description: Add an order to close the contract once the order condition is met (currently only for MULTUP and MULTDOWN)

stop_loss.description: Contract will be automatically closed when the value of the contract reaches a specific loss.

take_profit.description: Contract will be automatically closed when the value of the contract reaches a specific profit.

multiplier.description: [Optional] The multiplier for non-binary options. E.g. lookbacks.

selected_tick.description: [Optional] The tick that is predicted to have the highest/lowest value - for tickhigh and ticklow contracts.

trading_period_start.description: [Optional] An epoch value of a predefined trading period start time

price.description: Maximum price at which to purchase the contract.

passthrough.description: [Optional] Used to pass data through the websocket, which may be retrieved via the `echo_req` output field.

req_id.description: [Optional] Used to map request to response.
